content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
ARMA II: Operation Arrowhead is best known for the popular zombie mod DayZ, which is a unique apocalyptic open-world experience.But what many of the players who bought the game only to try DayZ miss out on, is the vanilla game itself and the original experience when you join an organized clan or server to teamwork with other players during tactical missions. All servers use unique player-created missions.The missions are normally PvE, but PvP also exist to a lesser extent. Missions can range from being in an escort of military vehicles, rescue hostages, or attack/defend outposts. The game has a built-in mission editor that is easy to manage. ARMA II have plenty of realistic weapons, vehicles and characters. There are also hundreds of mods that increase the amount of everything.The game suits people who like sandbox, simulations and action games. However, it's not a very fast-paced game like the CoD or BF-series. In the ARMA-series, you might die unless the wound is treated. You have no visible healthbar and you require a map and GPS to know where you are.Useful links:Clans & Communities - Find a clan that fit you.Armaholic[www.armaholic.com] - One of many sites with plenty of usermade content.

												This game will always be embedded in my memory as one of my favorite games. Part of it is the game itself, but the majority of it is the community around it. The community I am specifically referring to is DayZAnarchy. The founder of DayZAnarchy, known as skunk, spent countless hours slaving away at his keyboard, scripting his server to be the best it could be. The work paid off, and I considered DayZAnarchy to be the best DayZ server there was. However, skunk passed away recently. No longer will DayZ be the same for me, or my friends. It makes me realize how much of his work I took for granted. I only knew him for a year, but I considered him a friend. If not for skunk, I would not love DayZ. Therefore, this is not only a review for DayZ, but a memorial for skunk.69/10 would f*** a pumpkin again. Rest in peace man.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2014
												After playing this for a few years now and obtaining over 1000 hours on this game, I think it is time I reach my verdict on it. I believe that, though this game has its challenges, it is one of THE greatest games ever devised for the Personal Computer. I feel like simply doing a Pro/Con review because it's the easiest to format.ProsDEDICATED playing and modding community - even after being out for several years, many people, myself included still play this game religiously.Incredible mod support - There are literally thousands of mods for this game. Hundreds of new, GIANT maps. Thousands of guns. Thousands of new unit types. Even entire overhall mods to change it into the Vietnam war or World War 2. Mods exist to change every sound in the game and graphical mods exist to ease the strain on lower end PC's or make the game more beautiful than it already was.Already expansive game - The game, minus mod support, already contains hundreds of units, vehicles and guns in the case of Combined opsMaps - 15km by 15km maps, enough said. Maps contain multiple towns and villages, and often 1-3 large cities and/or settlements. There are also large area with beautiful landscapes such as rocky cliffs and washing oceans.  Some custom maps can be even bigger. But to put it into perspective, Skyrim's map is about 37 square kilometers, where as the default OA Takistan map is 164 square kilometers (About 12km by 12km corner to corner). Think about that one.Replayability - I do not mean the story when I talk about this, I talk about the virtually INFINITE ability to create scenarios in the editor. Want a tank battle 20v20? You got yourself a tank battle complete with terrain big enough to house it and FOBs for both sides. Want a small special ops team to assassinate a middle eastern dictator from 1.2 km away with a 50 cal? You got it. Want to fly an attack helicopter or CAS jet into the heat of battle? You get the idea. Infinite.Graphics - Though this is something that many people would argue with me about, Arma 2 came out in 2009. Even though it was released later, OA's graphics are no better because the game is still from 2009. It's the same engine and the same game, with a different setting. Given the circumstances, I do have a very nice rig, so the graphics look pretty to me. I constantly find myself looking off a cliff while preforming recon on an enemy position and thinking "Wow, look at that view."Realism - This may be a turn off point for many. I, for one, live for realistic games. I often b!tch to myself about other games not being realistic enough. This game, with the addition of a few mods, can be as close to real life as you want it to be. Mods to check out for added realism are ACE 2, Retexture mods for units to make them up to date and state of the art (Changing the US Army units to Multicam from that dreaded UCP camo comes to mind), and the Zeus AI mod.Multiplayer - 100 + player games. Nothing else to say.Now for the cons, these are all the problems that I've found with the game that personally annoy me.Lag/Desync - This is only an issue with larger servers, usually. It can be annoying but rarely 100% game breakingPoor Performance - This game is not very well optimized, and if you have a weak computer, you will struggle to run it with more than 10-15 FPS. Even if you have a good rig, it will usually only max out at about 35-50 FPS. Don't let this turn you off though, you really just get used to it.Ocasional hackers - This happens very infrequently, and it only happens on big servers.Expensive - For a game as old as it is, it is a bit pricy, I reccomend waiting until a Steam sale comes around to make a purchase in the Armaverse.Lack of Realism in Some Places - This is more of a pet peeve of mine rather than an actual flaw. It annoys me that all the US Army units use the SCAR L, considering it was rejected by the Army. The light version of the SCAR is just ugly to me, and when I can, I always mod it out of the Army. This will probably not bother 90% of people considering this game, but for those that enjoy absolute realism, check out the RH M4/M16 pack on Armaholic and it's respective replacement packs. STEEP Learning Curve - Patience is a virtue. You need patience for this game. A lot of it. You will die. A lot. And you'll die some more. Guess what still happens to me regularily. You guessed it. This game is a tactical simulator, if you try to play Call of Duty, you will be swiss cheese every time. The controls can be hard to learn, and I changed them right away so I was more comfortable. Modding the game is not reccomended unless you have experinece modding similar games. Though modding is very simple, things can be screwed up if you delete or put a file in the wrong place.Time Consuming - Processes in the game take a very long time. Firefights can be anywhere from a few seconds to 30+ minutes. The time it takes moving from place to place ranges widely. If you are on foot, expect about a 35-40 minute walk from one corner of a map to another. By plane or helicopter, you can travel long distances in minutes and seconds.Frusturating - It feels really bad when you're almost done with a mission or objective, and get killed.Overall this game is by far my most played and one of my most treasured games of all time. Very few games have the scope of Arma 2 and its many addons. PS: Arma 3 is much less realistic in terms of units and gameplay, but still has the giant maps and mod support. It does have better graphics, as well. I reccomend getting both if you can afford them.EDIT: MAKE SURE YOU BUY COMBINED OPERATIONS OR THE GAME WILL SUCK.

This review is for both Arma 2 & Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead combined. It is recommended to buy both games so you get all of the content and can join all the servers.Arma 2 is a realistic Military Simulator. Below I will review each aspect of the game.  Aspect Review   Gameplay The game has very enjoyable gameplay, with many different weapons and vehicles. You can do missions, play with the editor or play on multiplayer servers with many different game modes. Even if you aren't a fan of realism, this game can still be played casually.   Graphics and Optimisation The game is horribly optimised. Even people with top of the line PCs get around 20-40FPS at times. I personally have old hardware so cannot test the graphics properly, but at low they are still decent, but don't expect Arma 3 like graphics. The game gets extremely frustrating after a while due to the poor framerate. It should also be noted that the controls for this game are extremely uncomfortable to use, by that I mean it is unsatisfying and is the main problem I have with this game.   Additional Content The game features some additional DLC, however not owning the DLC is no problem at all, since the light versions allow players to gain all of the content from the DLC. However, the DLC content will be low resoloution, unless you buy the DLC. The game has no microtransactions. The game can be somewhat pay to win depending on the server, as some servers offer better weapons for premium players, but this isn't every server.   Value The game is worth the full price, as it is very enjoyable and you can get a large amount of hours out of it (for me it doesn't even get boring!). However, some people do not like the game. I recommend trying out the demo before buting the game. The game also goes on sale frequently, so it is worth waiting for that.   Aspect Score (/10)   Gameplay 9   Graphics & Optimisation 3   Additional Content 10   Value 7   Pay to win? No   OVERALL 8 Notes: This game is enjoyable both offline and online. It is one of the best military games I have played, but It is not to be confused with fast-paced action FPS games such as CoD. The 2 games are very different.

Posted: June 9, 2016
												1000+ hours but didn't purchase this on Steam till after I was pretty much done with this game.This is probably my favorite game of all time. I never played a game more than this one and I will say why in this review.Back in 2011 or 2012 I remember being bored and looking for new games to play since I was new to PC gaming and always played on Consoles before this. I remember coming across a YouTube video about Arma 2 realism shooting. I thought it was interesting since I grew up playing Halo and COD when I was a kid. I seen this was something new so I thought to give it a go. I came for the realism but stayed when I noticed a server called "Cherno life". I had no idea what it was but it sounded interesting. --- My RP Experience ---I load into the server and I see there are Cops and Civilians. I learned that day what a online RP game was like back then. It was the funniest thing I have ever seen. People playing as Cops and chasing people who would rob a bank or gas station or commit murder. Even things like speeding got you pulled over. I never seen anything like it and I just loved it. I remember one day I got tired of some people playing as Cops just doing stupid things like killing civs for no reason and it annoyed me but I was in luck. I came across a video that had "City Life RPG" as the title. It was a mod and the very first I went and downloaded. It had things like sports cars and even ♥♥♥♥♥♥ 1979 Honda Civics in the game and if you couldn't afford that than I guess you could test your luck on stealing a car but the cops could find out and you could be put in jail and that isn't fun.There was just so much to do in that mod, you could grow drugs and run a business doing it. You could do the boring legal route to and sell olives which hardly made money but it wasn't illegal. Fishing and illegal fishing (shark hunting) was a thing and if you wanted to just be clean you could even become a cop which was hard as hell to do in this server. Robbing banks was even a choice but usually a stupid one unless you had snipers or were good at tricking the cops otherwise it wasn't worth it. It was pretty much GTA but with real people instead of A.II put at least 1000+ hours into that mod because it was so different and niche that it just appealed to me. I even met people on there who I still talk to today 5 years later. The mod just had one of the best communites ever and nothing comes close to it for me. Like I said in the beginning, I came for the realism side of the game but the RP side I accidently came across kept me playing it for a very long time.--- DayZ Mod ---When I started playing Arma 2, I remember there being 4 DayZ servers. They weren't that popular either but I tried it one day and I loved the idea and the game itself. It was something that has never been done back then. I remember this mod just blowing up and 4 servers became a 1000 in 2 months. Arma 2 went from a niche game with 4,000 people playing at most to one of the top PC games out there all thanks to this mod. Survival games have been changed forever because of the success of this mod that was made into a full standalone years later and is still one of the biggest Early Access titles in history. DayZ was fun with friends but after a few months of playing it and things like Overpoch, EPoch started coming out and all the hackers started joining it kind of going annoying. Combat logging was huge back then to which ruined the mod for me but in the beginning I think it was one of the best mods ever to release.--- Realism Mods ---Played some realism mods for a bit because that is what I was looking for in Arma 2 in the first place. Mods made it so fun to play and for awhile I enjoyed it. I did this for around 3 months and just got tired of the ego some people had. The community kind of ruined it for me but overall I still enjoyed it. Some of the best mods I have ever seen in a game like DayZ so this was nothing short of incredible.I said this before and I will say it again. My favorite game of all time. One of the best communites (in some mods, DayZ was pretty bad after awhile.) and the best mods I have ever seen created in any game. I would recommend this game in 2012 but not 2016. Its kind of dead these days because its such an old game. It might still be worth playing for DayZ mod though since this game goes on sell for as cheap as $2 sometimes. Otherwise just wait for a sell.Best game ever thanks to the modding community.

												Sincerely, one of the best games I've ever played.The base game and it's DLC are of sufficient depth as to keep you busy for quite a while.  The learning curve to master controls is a bit steep, but once you're proficient, you're set.If you want true milsim, there are plenty of mods and communities to support that.If you're into the whole post-apocalyptic undead-walking scenario, there's a little mod for that as well.In playing this game, I have had some of the most boring times and some of the most exciting times I've ever experienced, and I've had it go from boring to HOLYFXKK in mere seconds.I've fought for my life against great odds and come out on top, I've been shrekt by cheap AI, I've outsmarted entire groups of players (and had them compliment me by accusing me of scripting), and I've walked away from my keyboard while my character crawled a few km to a town so I could fix my broken leg.This game won't always reward you for playing it, but when it does, it's a true reward.

												Not just a combat simulation.... A fun simulation.....Seriously this game gives so much bang for your buck. The amount of hours you can sink into Arma2/OA are insane as there somethng for just about anyone here from the vehicles and weapons to the walking and the missions/operations. There are communities within the game that put on 40+ men operations that take hours and have an insane amount of detail and coordination. Just watch any of the shaktac community's videos and all the different perspectives you can see of a single operation. It's ♥♥♥♥ing awesome and however I myself have never gotten this close to what seems to be the true arma experience I have gotten a more toned down taste of it with several friends doing small missions that just give you this sense of scale and enjoyment you wont find in other games. Outside of its military simulation and the mods that further improve on that aspect you've got mods that have become something like garrys mod in there selection. To name a few; Takistan life, Wasteland, DayZ, Escape Chernarus, a hunger games type and many many more. Your options of play are endless and the mods are just as well done and provide just as much if not more than the base game. Hell Im sure a majority of people that have bought the game did so just to play DayZ. That itself spawned a stand alone game (That is and probably never will be on par with the mod). This game is the represent what it means to be a PC gamer. The experience and freedom you simply cannot get on console. But seriously there are so many key bindings and actions some arent even binded by default and you have to manually go in and find what else you need or want to bind. I've tried rebinding keys to make it more functional for me but I always end up missing a key or running out of keys in a comfortable area. The worst part is I cant tell if this is black mark on the game for being complicated or praise for its complexity and amount of input.... its just brilliant.

												Definitely one of the best simulator games this platform has to offer. Besides DayZ mod you can do so much more like Wasteland (base building and pvp gamemode), make custom missions, player made maps and playing around in the armory with your friends in an online server. Pretty good singleplayer, although I think the multiplayer with all it's gamemodes is where this game truly stands out. If you missed out on the hype and still want to play DayZ mod, I would highly recommend Overpoch by CCG. Either Taviana or Chernarus are both great maps for this mod. Taviana being the best in my opinion. + Gameplay and general feel+ More content than Arma 3 at the moment (e.g. weapons, vehicles, items)+ Operation Arrowhead DLC was free+ Custom maps made by modders (Taviana, Lingor, Namalsk, Sahrani, Panthera)+ DayZ Mod+ Comes with alot of default maps (like Takistan, Chernarus, Utes, Bystrica)+ Alot of different gamemodes+ Great fanbase and community- Graphics (depending on what settings you play on, but on overall high settings it becomes laggy in multiplayer)- Uses more CPU power rather than GPU- Clunky inventory system compared to ARMA 3- Vehicles drive like a cereal box- No weapon customizationThis game is in my opinion better than ARMA 3. Mainly being because of the timeset. I like the weapons better (M4's, AK's, DMR's) and there's alot more vehicles to choose from. ARMA 3 is a bit too futuristic for my taste, and the weapons in that game do not make any sense. Overall 10/10 and highly recommendable.

												I´ve spend 1.5k hours of my life on this game. Thats one of the best ways i can explain this game. ArmA 2 in only one word: Fun! Every time i think about ArmA 2, i remember the old DayZ days with my friends, and oh boy, i can tell you guys, DayZ Mod was the best time ive spend on steam. But i dont wanna talk about my memories, i wanna give you guys a serious review, so lets get started:Weapons: There is a big variety of weapons, and a lot of different options for every weapon, for example theres your "vanilla" m4, and then theres options with holo sights, grenade launchers, silencers and so on. Its not like in ArmA 3 where you can put the attachments on by yourself, but its still well made. Also, every weapon feels, sounds and looks different. The Weapons dont feel as realistic as ArmA 3 weapons do, but you still have to compensate for bullet drop, and the velocity of the bullet. Maps: There are many maps in ArmA 2, and they are all unique and well made. Theres definetly a lot to explore, and have fun on playing!Gamemodes: Well, this is kind of sad, but theres not really any other servers than DayZ nowadays. But lets be honest, i think the main reason people buy ArmA 2 is DayZ, just because its unbeatable by the SA.Movement: Well, the movement in ArmA 2 is not as complex as it is in ArmA 3. Of course you can lean, crounch, prone, walk and run. The movement system feels smooth, and is reliable.Overall: This game guys, let me tell ya, its one masterpiece of a game! Buy it, seriously, buy it! Its worth every penny, and for 15 euros its in my opinion the best game you can buy at this price point. And if you just want to test it out, and you dont think its worth 15 euros, then buy it on sale, you can get this game for 2 euros. Once you get into the game, you cannot stop playing it, trust me guys!

content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
												Introduction:ArmA 2: Operation Arrowhead is the standalone DLC (Downloadable Content) Pack for ArmA 2, A Military Simulator by Czech developer Bohemia Interactive. ArmA 2: OA is the only standalone DLC pack for ArmA 2. Multiple other DLC packs play part in Takistan, Including the BAF (British Armed Forces) DLC and PMC (Private Military Contractors) DLC.The Map(s):ArmA 2: OA is set in the fictional Middle-Eastern country of Takistan. Takistan has many towns, villages and cities to explore, with two airfields on either end of the map. The map of Zargabad, A Small desert city in the middle of nowhere, quite small compared to Chernarus or Takistan, but the city is hugh compared to Takistan's largest, Rasman. Zargabad also comes with an airfield and a few buildings here and there. the PMC and BAF DLCs use this map as well.The Gameplay:ArmA 2, as a military simulator has many aspects involved in succeeding. To me, and many others, the most important is Teamwork. You have to work as a team to get things done in this game, and I love that consept. It is very slow paced, very tactical, and aimed at people that don't like to get things done rambo-style. Movement is extremely fiddly with the inability to walk through clearly enterable spaces and breaking your legs on the oddest of places. The game is fairly old, however, coming in at a 2010 release, a year after the original ArmA 2.Graphics/Voice Acting:Graphics and Voice Acting are quite shameful, but the game is old and developed by a Czech developer making an english game, and the quality is tolerable.The Multiplayer:The ArmA Multiplayer is quite easily where the most fun is to be had. With excessive mods and gamemodes developed plus the original gamemodes implemented to play with your friends, i've spent 99% of my OA Experience on the Multiplayer. My most enjoyable moments on the multiplayer moments were on Takistan Life: Revolution servers. TLR, as it is abbreviated to, is a Roleplay Mission File for OA.My Issue(s):My only Issue with OA is the fact that when update 1.63 was released, it wiped out an extremely large fraction of all multiplayer servers. I took this as a sign of BI telling us to go to ArmA 3, which is quite rude. Luckily, servers are popping back up here and there, which is a very good sign.Summary:Overall, All ArmA games are amazing in my opinion, but ArmA 2: OA gets the cake. Congratulations to Bohemia Interactive for making such an enjoyable, but serious game and I hope this review was found helpful.Overall rating: 9.5 out of 10 / 4.5 out of 5.

												It was a drizzly day in the Chenarus. As usual, I was sitting in the woods, listening to the majestic sounds of nature, the birds chirping, the wind murmuring through the trees, as I waited to see other people. All of a sudden, "POWPOWPOWPOW". Instinctively I dropped down, and heard the sounds of bullets rushing past me, which sounded completely different than how Hollywood makes it sound. I judged the direction of where I was taking fire from. 40 ... 43 ... 45 ... 3 o clock! I saw a dark clad man jogging forwards holding a Russian PKM, which he probably found in a helicopter wreck. As I raised my gun, my M16A2 ACOG, I adjusted the scope to compensate for the bullet drop, and leaded my target."POP! POP!" I heard the scream of the man, and decided to slowly inch forwards. He wasn't done yet. 20 meters away, he suddenly opened fire. "RATATATATA!" He was injured. Instead of his shots hitting me, they went right into the ground, because he was forced to prone after his legs were broken. With one shot, I silenced him. Then, I took some food and ammo from his body, and went out to seek more targets.10/10

												Despite not playing very often anymore, this game still has a thriving community (mostly in DayZ Mod servers) and is still very fun all around. It was the sole reason behind me making a Steam account, back when the original version of DayZ was gaining popularity. To this day, I still go back on to play with friends that I've met on DayZ or through Arma, or at the very least play recklessly on a Wasteland server, which requires no mods. Yes, the game can be very buggy, the community toxic more often than not, and ping issues may plague you, but this game has been the source for untold hours of fun, frustration, rewards, tense situations, and insane gameplay for so many people. I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to access and explore a game with so many dynamic features and meet some awesome people; there is a well-grounded reason why this game has 14x more positive reviews than it does negative reviews.

Posted: March 16, 2014
												I LOVE this game. It's a tactical shooter/military simulator that has singleplayer, coop, and PvP. There are hundreds of vehicles, weapons, and player models for you to use, so each time you play, you try something new. However the game also has some parts that bring it down. I will list all the good/bad points.The good:Emphasis on realismEmphasis on multiplayerWide array of equipment, all usable in-gameSmall but active, mature and helpful communityGood graphicsGood atmosphereEasy to learn, difficult to masterLarge map, open world. Able to travel over entire countryGood inventory systemFun custom missionsReplayabilityThe bad:Bad voice acting. Every time you order people around, it feels like all the words are spliced. For example: "team RED. go to that TANK"Clumsy infantry movement. While sprinting around for kilometers in open areas feels fine, moving around in buildings is slow, clumsy, and innefecient. You will notice that you either move too fast or slow for CQB, and that your gun won't fit through doors unless you're holding it down.Large amount of HDD space taken up. This game can take up around 15 gigs on your hard drive.No low-spec computer support. While you can turn graphics options down, you will find it hard to target enemies over 1 kilomenter away when everyone's texture is just a blur and there's a great big wall of fog right where they are.The engine. There are no ragdoll physics at all, object collision doesn't always work, shadows take up much processing powerAll in all, if you can get past the poor engine, you will find this game extremely addictive and fun. 8/10

												The Arma series has always held interest for me. It is one of the few shooters that has a learning curve. content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												'Do you recommend this game,' Steam asks me. I do, emphatically. I hope this anecdote from an in-game multiplayer experience I had will explain why. Prepare yourself for ARMA2: The Review: The Movie.Spring, 2011; early in my ARMA career, first tour of duty after a Steam Sale. I'm a fairly fresh recruit, seasoned with a couple dozen game-hours spent trudging through an expansive and swampy learning curve. Spent today at work, drove home, made dinner, cleaned up; it's Game-O'clock. Steam. ARMA2. Launch. Menu surfing, looking for multiplayer. Server browser hits my face with lists of information. -AWP-Warfare Capture the Island mode looks appealing tonight. Played it a couple times before, and I feel comfortable with the basics by now. Server connection established.Click! I'm in, filling the boots of a digital NATO badass. Apparently, international treaty organisations occasionally require the service of men with guns. Disturbing thought, but I'm no politician. I'm just a nobody with a rifle, taking orders that filter down the food chain. Those orders fill my mind now. Objective: town. Location: nearby...as the crow flies. Heh, the team's commander does have airborne technology unlocked, I just don't have the cash to buy a lift yet. Looks like I'm taking the scenic route. A quick check of my map tells me I'm at one of our hidden frontier bases and that there's two whole mountains between me and the nearby town. Great... I'll be taking the scenic route to the scenic route. The map tells me more: several of my team members and their A.I. controlled task forces are currently approaching the town. I'm already late for the party :(Might as well bring the fireworks.The base I'm at has only an armour factory and infantry barracks, but both will well suit my rapidly forming battle plan. I'm thinking heavy calibre fire support from high ground, overlooking the town. The topographic information in the map shows that the road I'll be taking is nestled around a minor hill as it approaches the town. Perfect. I'll park two BMPs there and they'll provide overwatch of the whole area while my comrades finish their capture of the town. An LAV will ferry me and one squad of A.I. infantry to the combat zone. I spend the required funds and set the plan in action.Wait a tick, BeatYourHeadIn, are you telling me you actually have to plan how you’re going to get your troops and equipment from point A to point B in ARMA2? Logistics in a game!? Yes, actual logistics...in a game with a map so FRIGGIN’ big you need to employ logistical planning skills to see any sort of success. And it's not boring!Back to the story. Formation of a military convoy. A few orders issued to my A.I. controlled task force later and the BMPs are on point while I lounge in the command chair of the LAV at the rear of the column. I man the turret-mounted automatic grenade launcher, a devastating weapon. Its barrel is ominously pointed at and tracking a lollygagging friendly player as my convoy departs base. Yeah, that's right chump, make one wrong move and I'll end you! Though itching to test the power of my new toy, I decide it's not worth getting banned over.  I let my teammate live, for now.The A.I. drivers of my convoy are as dim as a new moon, but I can fine tune my plans and keep up with current events while they drive. It's an 10 to 15 minute (realtime) drive that negotiates a winding mountain pass through an elegant evergreen forest. These are backroads, unpaved; enemy forces unlikely to be using this route. I feel secure enough that I spend most of the trip looking at the map, reading topography, lanes of fire, positions of friendlies. I smile when I realize I could probably minimize ARMA2 and play a few rounds of Counterstrike while my convoy travels.Dying immediately is certainly the last thing I'm worried about as I crest the peak of the second mountain.Suddenly: EXPLOSION..DEAFENING SOUND..FROM BEHIND..MASSIVE DETONATION..JESUS H. CHRIST WHERE IS THAT VOLUME KNOB! What is going on here!?My turret pans to the rear of the LAV. The sight, what a sight...I'll never forget. Fire. Wall. 60? 70 feet tall? A wall. Of fire. Taller than the trees in the forest, literally FILLS my view from left to right. There is nothing in view except the fire. I'm in awe. Confused. Shaken. I've seen 'splosions in this game before, BUT NEVER LIKE THAT! Did somebody tried to nuke me FFS!? I know there's no nukes in this game mode, so...Over the cacophany of destruction: the scream of jet engines. Very close. As the flames die down, a large shape traverses the air over the crest of the crag. Airframe, Sukhoi configuration. Enemy. Wing tilted down slightly; canopy visible. I know he's surveying the carnage below him. Hunting me. Cursing his aim when he sees the LAV still intact. I feel small, molecule small; what I just witnessed was caused by his war machine. Napalm bombs. Heavy ordinance. Whatever it was, it dealt complete destruction to that forest.Understand this, readers: in this game, air superiority is a literal phrase. Air is SUPERIOR in this game. This isn't your Battlefield "oh look I can shoot a few rockets from my jet fighter and maybe kill one or two goofs on the ground and then reload (because reloading rockets on a flying jet makes a lot of sense) and kill a couple more goofs" experience. No! In ARMA your aircraft can have a payload of more than a hundred devastating rockets and you can fire 'em full auto like a machine gun and destroy an entire town worth of goofs on the ground if you wanted to. Ha! Forget about balance! This is the real life Shiznit. Modern air forces don't invest heavily in war planes because they're "balanced". They invest in them because they can kill a hell of a lot of people quickly! ARMA2 knows this. Simply put, the developers have a big Bohemian boner for air power.But BeatYourHeadIn, what happened next? Tell us! Okay, I'll tell you. A miracle happened. My convoy survives the 'splosion to end all 'splosions. My battle plans go up in smoke like the forest around me. My current objective is to live through the next 30 seconds. The LAV is the only reason I'm still alive. It is damaged, but drivable. I order my drivers to haul♥♥♥♥♥in a forwardly direction. I track the Sukhoi as the convoy labours onward. The receding bogey performs a wide highspeed U-turn. He's heading straight for me again. Relentless much? He's the UPS guy we all wished was real: the one who comes back after he missed you the first time, instead of leaving a note telling you to pick up your package at the office near the airport!Then, from beyond the first mountain I had passed: a smoke trail racing skywards. Anti-aircraft missile! Ha! RETURN TO SENDER, A-HOLE! Two vectors intersect in a puff of smoke and light. Direct hit! Booyah! Wait, uh... he's still flying at me. HEY! HE'S STILL FLYING AT ME!With black smoke billowing out of his engines, this topgun is still determined to deliver my severance package. Frantically, I order the BMPs to target the limping jet. Cannon rounds arc through the sky in attempt to smite the airborne menace. Sukhoi Dude is getting closer, but he's losing altitude. Fast. He's now descending below my level on the mountain, looking up at me through the trees as he approaches. None of the BMP fire connects, but it doesn't matter. THIS GOOSE IS COOKED BOYS! Relief. Now, his desperation salvo of rocket fire is way off-target; falls harmlessly some distance away. I watch him frantically yaw right and nose up as his fighter loses the last of its life-sustaining lift and plummets in a sideways cartwheel into the trees. The inferno he leaves behind is a feast for the eyes. There was nothing left but a dark crater.Now, I can start thinking about that town again...What, are you apes gonna dig him a grave!? We got our own mission to die for! Forward march!All that's left to say is: play this game!

Posted: January 23, 2015
												What can I say? It's the one and the only ArmA II: Operation Arrowhead, probably one of the most well known games amongst the PC gaming community. This game has everything for everyone. You want to stroll around in a zombie infested wasteland full of players trying to kill you instead of zombies? It's got that! You want to fly in a special ops raid on an insurgent filled town at night with the glow of green illuminating your room while tracers fly on the screen? It's got that! You want to play as an abusive cop and beat down the local civilian population for driving in the middle of the road? It has that too. Yes ArmA II:Operation Arrowhead has just about everything you could ask for, but it does have stuff you didn't ask for. Like AI's that are either blind of Vasili Zaitsev, Zombies that come through walls to get you, and other weird glitches that although are not game breaking, are annoying at the best of times. Whatever your fortay me be in video games, I am sure that Operation Arrowhead can fullfil many of your hopes and expectations from a now old, military simulator that is at the top of its respected genre of games. Whether you want to be a pilot, infantry soldier, tank operator, marksmen, civilian, rebel, or police officer this game can give you what you want. It is for these reasons and more that you will discover, that I recommend this game even so long after its initial release.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2010
												ArmA II (Armed Assault 2) is one of the best war simulation  games i've ever played (together with ArmA 3 and  Operation Flashpoint: Dragon Rising).  The realism is   amazing *second only to ArmA 3), the massive open world nature of the game  and the different modes of play that are available, plus the   extra non essential  DLC that you can purchaseall add  depth to this superb game.  It's not  a Call of Duty, in yer face shooter, with  a linear   SP campaign, but a versatile, open   game with a mission editor  and loads of  free  custom made content that'll see you playing this game  for years to come. (I've played more than double the hours  that are quoted on my profile as I originally owned the  disc version of the game before I purchased it via Steam)  The environments you can explore in  ArmA II and expansions  are massive, covering  hundreds of square miles of  forest, country side, towns, villages and desert regions.  There's  masses of  weapon types, loads of vehicles and   airborne  planes and choppers that you can  play with and the online community  is  massive.  The game    is also   set up to use the track IR (a tracking device that allows you to look around  the games environment and frees up your hands  as you can lean around corners just by tilting your head instad of using  the Q & E keys, or you can look behind you , lean forwards and you zoom in on your enemy.  The hardware is expensive, but it gives an unparralelled   immersivness to the game.For me, ArmA II is  by far one of the best military simlation I've ever played (the only exception so far being ArmA 3).  If you like to  play a stealth game this is definitely the game for you; no run and gun, but a real military simultion.

												After years of playing Arma ever since Operation Flashpoint Cold War Crisis back in 2001, this game is great, It has quite alot of content and replayability value, but however after the release of Arma 3 Apex, this game seeems more and more like a distant past but a very good forefather to Arma 3. Alright lets get down to it. The game is very fun to play its another of Bohemia Interactive's Military Simulation, Open World, Free-Roam, Singleplayer, Coop, Multiplayer and you name it of what tags it can go under, It can go under just about any tags, depending on what mods you use really, The game is extremely moddable, thousands upon thousands of mods to this game, But there are things that displeased me alot about this game, Mainly the day and night cycle, Daytime is fine no problem, but the night time is horrible, you literlly cant see♥♥♥♥♥♥1 meter infront of you or in other words 3 feet. That was quite frustrating especially with DayZ, where you had no Night Vision Goggles. (HIV Confirmed). However thats not the worst, The Optimization in this game... can be a bit weird with certain computers, On mine it ran OK. But if i were to turn it up you got massive framerate loss compared to Arma 3, of course Arma 3 uses a updated Engine and so on. But this game really is a stinker when it comes to Optimization. Even though the Graphics are great for It's time. For People With Low End to Mid End Gaming Rigs: And you as you read this  wonder if this is worth your money since you have a low to mid-end gaming rig, well my suggestion is No. That is, because its really ironic, Arma 3 runs far better on lower end rigs than this game would ever do. You would get more Framerate in Arma 3 and of course would have a better experience with Completely new reworked physics, graphics and other game mechanics that runs very well on low end PC's compared to this game. But again. But On what I truly appreciate about this game. Takistan Life. HAHAHA, gotta be one of the most fun version of Life I've ever played, honestly. Despite the flaws in this game you can look past it, but Im on looking forwards, I probably wont return to Arma 2 ever again, but I will always have fond memories with friends in this game on all the stupid fun♥♥♥♥♥♥we did. content:
Posted: December 10, 2015
 Arma 2: Combined Operations REVIEW  Just so people don't get confused Combined Operations is Arma 2 + Arma 2 OA. Arma 2: CO is a fun military shooter while being realistic but not too realistic if you get what I mean.I can't say much about the campaigns as I have only gotten past the first mission on both Arma 2 and OA so I'll skip that section.The multiplayer is massive and can go upto nearly 100 players! (I've actually seen a server with a 200 player cap!) there is also a wide range of missions both default and user-made. However not all user-made missions are perfect and can have weird framerate drops, missing scripts and glitches. These missions range from generic deathmatches to total domination of the entire map with up to three factions brawling it out which is very fun if people ya know... Work TOGETHER. Which leads me to the community side of things.The community is rich with mods that add stuff like: armies from around the globe, weapons ranging from sci-fi sniper rifles to classic bolt-action rifles, maps of real world locations or comepletely made-up islands! There is so much modifications yyou just have to see it for yourself! The community is  most of the time  friendly and have loads of groups that play together with teamwork. Now here come the more dissapointing parts of the community. See you won't get much teamwork or friendlyness outside of these groups or clans. You WILL come across people who love to ruin the experience with people ranging from lowlife teamkillers (Sometimes its on accident) to hackers. You also get racists, random banners (Doesn't mean Battleye ban) etc. There is just a bad chunk of rot in the game so beware.You may also find it hard to actually PLAY ARMA 2! My goodness what ever you do if you want to PLAY ARMA 2 please for everything that is Arma USE THE FILTERS. The serverlist by default is spammed to absolute hell with DayZ. Which I consider a TOTALLY different community (They don't "play" Arma 2 they play DayZ).Now you may be thinking by most of the screenshots in the Community Hub  "These graphics are terrible"  Well...1. The graphics most people set its LOW, LOW, LOW, OFF, OFF, OFF and LOW with a hint of 800x600. These people are A. People who struggle with the game's unoptimized performance or B. Have♥♥♥♥♥♥PCs that cost $400.2. The graphics are quite nice maxed out (Not that I can max them out ;_;) and if these are below your standards may I suggest you give it a shot.Now the fun part! Gameplay is... Fun? Is that the right word? I don't care I think it is fun to play, bit clunky at some parts but it is generally all good. The main focus is infantry combat which is nicely in-depth with range finding, sneaking about, misc buttons, etc. The game has A.I. companions that tell you to do♥♥♥♥♥♥but where it's really at is commanding them... Which is a interesting experience. The A.I. ISN'T the best I will tell you that right now! They can go through walls (Only really happens with LOTS of A.I.) They can't drive properly even if their life depended on it but there are mods that make the A.I. better. You also have the ability to use heaps of cars, trucks, bikes, planes, jets, APCs, jeeps, tanks and helicopters all with a little difference or a massive difference in speed, mobility and armour.Now before I wrap this up this game is VERY far from flawless and you will experience bugs and glitches that will only ever happen in Arma 2 depending on what is happening these can be downright annoying or pure hilariousness! These are the following examples of what we call being "Arma'd"1. Death By PhysicsYou may be wondering  Wait other games can kill you by phsyics!  While you may be right but Arma 2's "physics" engine provides the most hilarious and interesting experience I've ever had in gaming.I've been killed by running into a non moving vehicle 3 times, I've had my legs broken or have been killed by rocks or similar objects more times then I can remember, I've been flung by vehicles further then the longest sniper shot and I've had my own vehicle flung into the air so high that it puts NASA to shame.  


I BELIEVE I CAN FLY! 
A Screenshot of Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead
By: RemrotS




2. ClonesThis may actually be a rare event but I have had my character produce a COPY of himself... I-I-I don't have the words to explain it! 


I'VE BEEN CLONED! 
A Screenshot of Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead
By: RemrotS




3. Invisible But-not-invisible BuildingsThis was annoying but yet so hilarious! I could see, interact and collide with buildings that other people could not! Just look at the screenshots!  Building  


Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead 
A Screenshot of Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead
By: RemrotS




 No Building  http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=550165759 This picture doesn't show like the rest, weird Overall this game has been one of the best experiences I've ever had and I recommend that you just give a shot because it may become one of the best experiences YOU may ever have.

 Get ready for a badass shooter! This will be semi quick, I've only been able to play about 30 - 45 minutes at a time before my latptop overheats (Will write an entirely new review later on, this is just to give a honest heads up on what to expect) so I don't know much about the scenarios quite yet or if they're worth playing but I can tell you that the bootcamp alone has me interested in playing as much as I can, I also learned this is NOT a fast paced shooter for the most part and is infact very strategic, I wouldn't know too much on how to handle the more commender-esque moments as I often played the "freeplay mode" and made a base asap for that UAV drone just to see what it's like up in the sky raining hellfire and let me tell you, the graphics for an older and non-AAA game shouldn't even compare to this game's as the locations are very well detailed and worth taking note of at times, I can't say I'm a fan of the land vehicle gameplay (HMV's and Tanks) but that's never been my cup of tea but I do like sitting back at 1000M and picking off pesky threats with a M24 while they spray violently and missing every shot along the way or taking out a small convoy with a unmanned drone, anyhow besides that not much is notable about the game as far as I can tell, the variety's fair regarding weapons/vehicles/etc (However without the original ArmA II you wont be able to use most of the normal gear or so on without paying a few extra bucks) and a fair amount of mods are out for this game that extends the realsm of this game by a ton.Imo this game is worthy of a Good rating on it's own, but as I mentioned earlier some of the variety of this game comes from the original ArmA II so if you plan to get this game then try to buy Combined operations.Combined operations (Original and Op:AH) 9.3/10Operation Arrowhead 8.5/10

There's something about the gameplay that is really fun and interesting once you're used to it. The DayZ mod is no doubt the best game you can play with your friends. The funniest moments I have ever had playing a video game took place in the DayZ mod. There's is so much freedom and endless possibilities for hilarious moments. There is nothing quite like how the anarchy works in DayZ mod.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												ARMA II: Operation Arrowhead has got to be one of the most amazing first person shooters I have ever been able to get my hands on. It is an amazing expansion to the already amazing AMRA II. It has an amazing blend of story and action with different yet very well thought out controls. For left and right handed people. The wide variety of vehicles and weapons works so well with the settings in which the game is based in. I absolutly love the multiplayer! The high number of servers with hundreds of thousands of people playing on them even to this day! This is also backed up by the ground breaking DayZ mod which has an amazing blend of the classic multiplayer's firefight action and a high number of zombies out to get your brains!Pros:- High number of players still active- High number of servers- Amazing graphics- Wide variety of things to do and weapons/vehicles to use- Great storyline- Amazing equipmentCons:- Complicated controls for helicopters and planes- A few glitches in the multiplayerOverall, ARMA II: Operation Arrowhead has gained itself a well earned 10/10!

												What do I have to say about Arma 2? Its great game and has so many things you can do, from fighting in the battlefield with your comrades to living a peaceful life as a civilian in the beautiful maps of Takistan, or Chernarus. But, don't mistake this for a simple sandbox FPS, It is far from it, I don't recommend this for people who are used to simple controls, unless you are willing to spend some time in the tutorial for a couple of hours. The campaigns with the DLCs and without them are amazing to play, except the one in the Army of the Czech Republic DLC. I personally give this game an 8/10 for great storyline in the campaign, the amazing modding capabilities in the game. The only faults I find are some bugs, the Army of the Czech republic dlc was disappointing since I couldn't really see the story behind it.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
												Best game ever, hands down. As long as you know atleast two friends who own this game.If you're gonna buy it, buy Combined Operations because both ArmA 2 and Operation Arrowhead are so cool and unique that you gotta have both of them.Very realistic military simulator but if you're playing on easy it can still be played like an action movie where an RPG takes down your tail rotor so you start crashing into a forest, everyone gets down and takes cover behind the chopper as your enemies converge on your position to make sure you're dead and an epic gun fight starts.The best aspect of this game is the scale and the amount of content. There's hundreds of vehicles, hundreds of weapons, hundreds of units, tons of maps, and like 10+ factions in total, all with their unique arsenals, vehicles, tactics and appearance. This game can either be played with a clan on huge scaled battles with medevac choppers on standby and armor swishing over the plains while getting carpet bombed by Warthogs or it can be played as a small rebel force, fighting either russians or americans or whatever you want, basically, hiding in the woods at night with only flashlights, waiting to ambush a convoy and steal their weapons and medical supplies.The best experience you can have in this game is with atleast 15 people because then you can experience the realism that this game is intended for and people don't have to multitask, such as one person being infantry and chopper pilot at the same time etc.This game is a solid 10/10 and most of the bugs in this game are managable and/or hillarious. Recommend using mods with this game, even if you don't like mods, some mods like ACE, you just can't live without.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												This is a review for the series in its totality. ARMA II and its expansions were a welcomed breath of fresh air to mainstream FPS/TPS games. Everything about this game is military ops to the letter. Real Time, Open world combat where one wrong step over a ridge can end you up flatlined. Tactical thinking is requierd in most situations on the campaigns, and sometimes even micro/macro management of your forces. Be aware that even though this game is kind of getting long in the whiskers, setting your visual settings to all high and max draw distance is not advised. The max draw distance of 10,000 (meters) will crunch even the best of Graphics card, and you will notice and performance drop. Every building in the game is descrutible (from what I have experienced). Also there are some bugs with ARMA II base game. They include, but are not limited to weapons/gear disappearing when exiting water, vehicles not spawning in when you buy them, AI getting vehicles stuck for no good reason or not properly moving to a waypoint, and in certain situtaions, losing command of certain purchased units, notably in your squad. Despite these flaws, ARMA II is still and fun and challenging series. And the multiplayer has loads of fun as well. Everything from testing weapons, to dropping a bomb on a group of civillians and watching them go sky high while your frames drop to the teens.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2014
												Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead/Combined Operations is a excellent military simulator that can be easily modded to fit the players' needs and can be a good Tactical Realism game when utilized to its fullest potential. Not a game recommended for players who expect aspects from Call of Duty, Medal of Honor, Battlefield, or other popular First-Person Shooters. In this Mil-Sim game, players are to think before they act; playing through the multiple scenarios in their head before executing their tactics. Communication is highly recommended since this game generally requires teamwork, collaboration, and team playing in order to accomplish missions. In addition, new players are highly recommended to play the "Boot Camp" scenarios in single-player mode until they feel confident enough to play on multiplayer servers. This includes, but not limited to Infantry Combat/Warfare, Controlling AI, *Flying Aircraft*, Driving Ground Vehicles, Understanding Logistics/Support, etc... The few flaws of this game are: 1) HACKERS & Team Killers. Indeed, hackers tend to lurk in multiplayer servers and to reduce the amount of gameplay from being ruined, join a server with an active admin. Team killers are an often occurance since new players do not identify targets before they shoot. 2) Poor AI. Although there are many mods that can fix this problem, the default AI behavior can be irritating for certain situations (e.g. piloting aircrafts, driving ground vehicles, infantry combat).3) Bugs/glitches. There are low chances that bugs/glitches may occur and can happen in the wrong place and wrong time. This is especially hazardous when you are flying an aircraft. Players tend to have to restart/reboot the entire game/computer to fix this problem.4) Lag and Frames Per Second issues. This common if you do not have a high-preformance computer, poor internet connection, or playing in a server hosted on the other side of the world (e.g. you live in the US but play on a server in the UK). Another common cause of lag is smoke and explosions. Smoke grenades, demolishing buildings, firing high volumes of Hydra rockets, explosions from artillery/mortars, and others can cause a significant decrease FPS which can reduce gameplay performance like player movement, camera panning, and others. Conclusion: Overall, this game is best Mil-Sim game avaiable to the public. *For the best Player Tips, Manuals, and Tactics, Google: Dslyecxi for entertaining videos on his YouTube channel, read/download his Arma Manuals from his website, or learn how to play like a professional.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2016
												I've owned this game for some years now and I tend to go back to it now and then. For me I really only bought this game for the Dayz Mod and kind of theft this game to rot in my library. I had never played the vanilla game and only used it to get to Dayz. However, when I did play it I couldn't get away from it. My 130 hours or so should explain that. Yes, most of that time I spent playing Takistan life with friends granted but other game modes were very interesting to say the least.  I never played the main campaign and don't tend to either, I believe this game is best when playing multiplayer; but only when you are with friends. Playing this game without a friend or two gets boring after a while, you can try and make new friends but if you're like me that isn't going to happen. Does anyone else love the glitches on this game ? I do, especially the ones on the Dayz mod where planes would bounce on the ground and you would die because of it, or when you try to vault into a blown up building only to break your leg. Loved it. The Dysnc! Oh god, if you want to be in the passenger seat and watch as the driver crashes into every tree in the game then this is the game for you to realise that it didn't actually happen? I like this game and always will do, but due to the lack of friends to play with and the fact I can't get the Dayz mod to work this game is some what dead to me now and will forever be a memory of the good times I had, an their were some good ones. 6.5/10. Why ? Because like I said before, its only fun when you're playing with friends and it gets quite repetitive after a while and very boring and stale fast,  and to many it is only a way to get to the Dayz mod which now for me is dead. Maybe if you were buying this is 2011-2013 then it would be great fun.

												ARMA II Operation Arrowhead is the very first expansion, and biggest for ARMA II, this can be played as a standalone game, and has a little more content than the original game. When DayZ first was released everyone was eye-ing this expansion as a way to install DayZ, since this was required. But people overlooked the quality of this standalone expansion. Taking place in a desert-like middle-eastern country, named Takistan, this is just a playground of destruction. With various gamemodes you can find yourself doing Co-op missions with friends, like flying helicopters, freeing hostages, clearing camps etc. Or you could do some full-scale massive gamemodes (Domination, Warfare, Deathmatch and Capture the island)This game is most definently must have, if you dig military sims, and are an owner of any of the other ARMA games.

ARMA 2: Operation Arrowhead is most definitely worth the purchase even if it is just for the mods.Personally, i bought both OA and Arma 2 solely for the purpose of playing the DayZ mod. Though in recent weeks ive discovered that both OA and Arma 2 have even more to offer as an online game. The use of the ACE and ACRE mods opens up the online skirmishing to a whole new level of realism and combat, and the extensive community which consistently develops more and more modifications for both Operation Arrowhead and Arma 2, means that theres always something new and interesting either being added or updated.Even still, if you're not too interested in the online aspects of the Arma series; the Single Player aspects offer much too - and the detailed and expansive world which has been created for you to battle in is both vast and utterly brilliant.I would wholeheartedly recommend this game, and the base Arma 2 game, as a must have for your Steam Library. Recommended?:  Wholeheartedly yes Score:  9/10

content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												I got ArmA 2 outside of steam back in 2012 before the gamespy shut down and since I bought it back then I have thoroughly enjoyed it. In total I have amassed at least 5,000 hours of actual gameplay.I bought the game because I was at a friends house who had the original ArmA 2 from 2009 and when I seen the game I thought there was a lot of potential because of how it is open world.Almost everyday since I have had the game I've played around an hour a day but recently it has started to decline due to the game dying due to old age and useless updates for the DayZ mod.I think it is safe to say that this game is a fantastic game although it may have a bunch of bugs still in it, but the time has come for Operation Arrowhead. It is a 7 year old game in June and there hasn't been any real significant updates since the last corepatch in winter 2 years ago (or so I think). There has been no new dlc, only BattlEye Anti-Cheat updates to keep the hackers out.People need to understand that it might seem like a good game to buy now, but I encourage you to save your money for ArmA 3 if you don't have it, or, Playerunknown's Battlegrounds.I have been watching the population of this game recently and there has been a steady decrease of players. Just 2 months ago there was an average of 5,000 people concurrently playing, this number has now halved and I don't see it increasing again.It has been a good journey, but the road must come to an end.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												What a perfect game this is. Remember this review is MOSTLY opinion orriented. This is after playing many hours, both alone and with friends. I don't know where to begin. There is SO much stuff to do, with SO many mod spin-offs (Such as Origins, Epoch, OverPoch.) that it could easily have you playing over 5000+ hours if you are hardcore.Absolutely INSANE amount of players/content. It actually feels geniunely terrifying when you get into a firefight. This is NOT a running simulator, as long as you put the effort in, you could have a working vehicle within 15 minutes of your spawn. Also, helicopters.AI Missions, in case you get bored and need some extra loot. Very diificult to do, but the payoff is insane.Helicopters/Jets, depending on the server. Awesome.Tons of weapons, pretty easy to find one.Here's a big one: KOSing is NOT a major problem. Unlike H1Z1, you actually have a chance at making friends most of the time.No microtransactions. Everything's fair.Large maps, could take you up to an hour to drive through the whole thing if you taking the road the whole time.No persistent loot, so you cannot just server hop.Friendly people are everywhere.Our lord, Frankieonpcin1080p plays this game.Do I recommend this game? Hell yes, forget H1Z1, THIS is the best Zombie/Survival game to date.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												It's been about 2 months since my original review,  and in that time I've watched many servers die. I'm almost at 600 hours in Arma 2, and have been through a couple Milsim groups and several servers.To those wondering if you should buy this, and you stumble upon my review by chance, take a moment and read.Pros:-A great milsim game. A pistol can kill you just as effectively as any other gun in this game, just like you'd expect in real life. The fancy guns dont make the good players. If you take the time to practice, you can use a CZ-550 and take out a guy with a M107.-Good community. In the many servers I'm come across, I've been greeted by nothing but a great community. I've met some of my now great friends in DayZ, the murder simulator, and some great friends in Arma 2 Takistan Life.-Lots of vehicles. If you're used to Battlefield and how you get tanks jeeps and helicopters there, get ready for an ♥♥♥♥♥♥. There's several different tanks, multiple different cars, several helicopters and jets, all with different weapons on them. It takes a while to learn them, which is a sad downside.Cons:-Lag. Unless you have Google Fibre and a beast of a PC, this game will lag on highly populated servers and will be practically unplayable in the large cities of Takistan and Chernarus. I run this on a $300 laptop, with really bad internet, but I'm able to get about 20 fps. Just make sure to mess with your graphic settings so that way you can get optimal performance.

content:
Posted: March 31
												I don't know why it shows so few hours played, while in fact I have finished the campaign. It must be because I played it with some DLC on, or I don't know.I found Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead extremely intriguing and enthralling. You get into a lot of realistic scenarios and you end up managing things at different levels. I would recommend it to gun nuts and whoever has an interest in military operations.Nevertheless, it has its downsides: the learning curve is very steep, and frustrating at times. The game also tends to crash every now and then. On top of this, there are bugs and glitches, which force you to become paranoid about details, but well beyond what should be reasonably expected in a game.I will make some examples, so to ensure you are well aware of the issues with the Arma game system:- You are well into a mission until you realize some of your men have been left behind. Are they wounded? What happened? Simply this: you gave the "everybody embark the vehicle" command and yet some of them didn't manage to get in (not because of vehicle size, but because all the trajectories of NPCs are glitchy and buggy);- Driving vehicles is a pain in the ***. And I am talking cars and motorbikes... not airplanes and choppers. Controls are realistic beyond reasonableness: all vehicles' drift and reactions to gravity and the like are extremely realistic. Only difference is that I don't "feel the wheel" while I'm sitting at my desk... thus making the entire vehicle experience painful to no end;- Sometimes, a mission will not be completed simply because of a bug... thus runing ages of gameplay spent getting to a specific point in the map;- Endless menus to control everything friendly AI does... you have to use all your keyboard just to get somebody to do something decent like searching for an IEDOverall, it is a very nice game, but picking it up after maybe one year not playing it... and I am back to step 0: I have to re-learn all keyboard commands from scratch. So annoying.

Posted: January 5, 2013
												I am literally in LOVE with this game.Arma is one of the very few games that has managed to suck out 200+ hours out of me, without me getting bored of the content within game. It is an amazing game that you should have at least tried if you are a gamer, I mean c'mon the Multiplayer of Arma II is free, and the best parts of the game are in the multiplayer!Arma 2 OA is a standalone expansion from Arma 2 and it offers a completely new experience to the other game with a whole new upgrade to the look and feel of the game which is worth the full title cost. It is set in the fictional country of Takistan which is torn apart by the OpFor forces stationed there and is trying to be recovered by the BluFor forces stationed three. The game also allows the player to play in the old map Chernarus, but only if you own a copy of Arma II or have the Arma II Free game installed. The single player gives you the experience of being there and commanding a unit. The single player also features parts where you are in control of your superiors and takes a different direction of how a mission is played. What it does is it gives you and objective, guidelines, but you don’t necessarily have to follow them, but for the sake of story and depth its best to play within reason. The game allows you to learn from your mistakes, adapt or play in way that nobody else has, For example I was in a mission where all my men died, and I had one injured man left, and I had to get to a rendezvous but we had to face about a chalk of men. From constantly dying in the mission, I learnt that I could not protect my teammate as he would die instantly from any damage, so instead of facing the enemy I ran off and took a stealth route, which I could complete but because of AI Intelligence, he couldn't. And it’s because of moments like that, that make the single player something really special.The multiplayer gives you an experience of user created gameplay that very few games allow you to do, and this is one of the trademarks of the series. With some game modes and missions that you can play together with others, most people prefer to play user generated missions or game modes. The mission side of things is very simple. You get given tools that with a basic knowledge of google search or scripting allow you to create a mission that could be put in the single player of the game itself. I myself have made a few of these types of missions, ranging from border patrols, races to a vehicle and weapon showcase created to test out all the vehicles and weapons in the game and enable anyone to learn how to fly a plane or helicopter in game, without getting yelled at for wasting a valuable asset in certain multiplayer game modes. Game modes made by independent developers or groups of people is where the main fan base of the game stands at. Some of these 'gems' include:-Domination, a team based game where you are part of an army working together fighting and liberating towns from the OpFor stationed in them. -DayZ which now has evolved into a standalone game, is a whole new game mode in which you are one of the many survivors of a zombie infestation and you try to live within that scenario getting over the many obstacles that would exist including in depth problems like health and blood loss and social problems like gangs bandits and trust.-I44 is a whole re-branding of the game. It’s called Invasion 1944 and is set during the invasion of American Troops into Europe. The whole game is remade with a WW2 feel, with iconic weapons, gear clothing and vehicles. You have at your disposal, the German, British and American army to play with playing historical battles or some of the user-Generated games modes within Arma II such as DayZ and Domination.-ACE Is an upgrade to the already semi realistic game that Arma is. It offers more depth, challenge and realism and is seen as a mod for the more hard core fans, or people that like a more difficult game or a more enhancing experience in comparison to the vanilla version. It achieves this by adding little details everywhere such as fainting and ear protection from explosions. Also it adds more difficulty with things like shooting and stamina making the game that one step more realistic.-WasteLand is a scavenge and co-operate game mode in which players must earn money to make and but defences for their team, with a goal of domination and annihilation of the other team and the land around. The last game mode I want to talk about RP civilian life or as it’s now known as 'RPG Life'. This game mode adds a Sims like aspect to the game, as you play a civilian who can live his life normally or he can become a criminal or rebel and fight the police force who are in charge of keeping peace in the country. With trading, working and doing normal things like eating and drinking this game mode is one that will never be the same twice. Now this isn’t a full review of the game so I'll stop at the game modes and not expand any further as I could go on forever, talking about this game. So in short I give this game a 85/100, the reasons?Some Positives:-Has a decent campaign with a whole new approach to how a mission can be done-The multiplayer is and unlimited canvas with almost unlimited potential.-The community is a wide and strong one adding a lot to the game itself.-The Semi-Realism is an enhancing experience that adds on a lot to the game.Some Negatives:-There are a lot of fundamental ideas that are expected to be seen in sandboxes that are missing.-There could have been a lot more things done by the developers than just leaving the community to handle it and where there was support it was usually not in the places needed-There are some really bad flaws in AI and horrible animations that really take away from the game

Posted: October 2, 2014
So I bought this game only for Dayz Mod which was awesome at the time. After SA (standalone) was released development and community mostly moved on to SA which is still a mess imho. Arma III is also out for a while which also splited the large community. Is it dead? Absolutely not.This game runns waaay smoother than ARMA 3, it has more content and very solid mods which are still very popular or even more popular than most Arma 3 mods.When you are new to the game and you are not interested in playing solo missions to get to know this game, mechanics, weapons and so on you can just hop on to a coop server and learn how to snipe with a wast variety of guns. Get to know CQC and operate vehicles.After a few hours of coop you might step up to wastland. There is some excellent servers out there which are nowhere to be find in Arma 3. The nr.1 server at the moment (arma 2) is TCF wasteland (110slots). Its a german server but has a huge international community (usa east, canada, UK, germany, russia I even drove a tank with 2 saudis once). This server game me the best Arma 2 experience possible. I dont say that to recruit players but  the balancing is just awesome. There is plenty servers out there which will give you exactly what you need. You think Hellfire Missiles are overpowered? You want no Thermal sights at all? No problem.Last if you are tired from non stop warfare you might want to go around one of the huge maps, loot some food and shoot some zombies along with other players by camping stary sobor or maybe build an awesome base in epoch or what ever Zombie-Mod is being played most atm.I guarantee you there is always something new to try out and even for free. No DLC. Get Arma 2 Combined Operations and you are set for at least a year of playtime.This game always keeps me from playing my "new" games since there is always something new to do. And if I should get bored of the hyped mods and server there is always fun guaranteed on wasteland for me. 1927m shot on a APC gunner who is about to rek my teammates. Quickly setup a roadblock with 12 people to keep enemies from getting that F35B jet at a special mission. After that Air-drop them in the enemie base after your team got the F35 and softened up the enemies stronghold 7km away.You are into FPS's which have alot to offer but the price will be 20-50h to learn the basics? This might be for you?You ask yourself why not just skip this one and go Arma 3..better graphics..blabla. Dont! Trust me on this one. Arma 3 is an awesome game but its lacking content. Sure there is Breaking point and the Live(or life) Mods along with king of the hill but I think Arma 2 has more to offer and is more solid with waaaay more content. I love Arma 3 but I think it will take up to 1 or even 2 years to fully catch up with Arma 2.Thats my thoughts on this game.

												Don't be fooled by my low playtime. Most of my time playing has been through mod launchers that didn't include steam overlay. My actual time played is likely between 500 and 1,000 hours.I can't recommend the base game without mods because I've never played the base game without mods. ACE and ACRE on a multiplayer server are what make the game amazing, and I don't think it's worth your time to play the single player game unmodded.Arma II is riddled with bugs and problems. It's an incredibly demanding game, even on modern machines. It hogs your CPU and can crash for literally no reason at all. If you're playing with other people (as you should) you'll likely spend hours standing around doing nothing, then get shot in the first few seconds of a firefight and spend the next five minutes staring at a black screen until the death screen pops up because you bled out.You'll drive down a dirt road at a snails pace watching for IEDs, only to get blown up by one you didn't see hidden in a bush. Then you'll drive down the same road, again, and when you arrive at you area of operation you'll take a bullet to the head and die instantly.Sometimes you'll have to sit around on a hilltop looking at enemies for 30 minutes while you wait for your fireteam leader to radio the squad leader, who then has to radio command, who then has to radio back questions, which are relayed to your fireteam leader, who answer them back to the squad leader, who radios back to command, who radios back to squad leader permission to engage, who sends back to your fireteam leader, who then tells you you can engage. And that's if everyone is listening to each other. More likely you'll sit around for thirty minutes while the fireteam leader tries to contact the squad leader who doesn't even have their radio on.Occasionally you'll gear up for a halo jump or fastrope operation, gather everyone on the tarmac, load up into the helicopter, wait for the pilot to discuss drop zone with your officers, then after fifteen minutes of flying your screen will go black with the sound of a surface to air missle blowing a hole through the cockpit.Believe me when I say Arma II has been the most fun and engaging video game I've ever played and if I could only have one game for the rest of my life it would be this.Arma III is apparently getting ok but it makes me sad that Arma II is being replace WHY CAN'T WE KEEP ARMA II OPERATIONS CAPTAIN?
