Posted: July 22, 2014
												This standalone title was released as an addendum to Arma 2. I will try to remain unbiased in this review despite the fact that i am a long time fan of the original OFP and Armed Assault series. This particular chapter of the series epitomises the milsim genre and is the quintessential PC game for people who enjoy working in unison with other players to undertake large virtual military operations on a massive scale, incorporating unique game mechanics resulting in an unwonted interdenomination of varied archetypal game genres   . The game has a great modding community and as such is full of brilliant addons and extra units made by the mod community who use the games Editor mode to stage scenarios for the units they choose to to revolve the scenario around . Ever since Steam added the Workshop feature as a tool for finding and installing addons, its become easier to apply them to the steam version of Arma 2 OA, bypassing the somewhat arduous process of adding downloaded content to their affiliated folders in the games main directory as was the norm before.. Addon content for this game is made by a large active community whos work has been invaluable in making this one of the most comprehensive and realistic combat experiences available to PC gamers and simulation fans worldwide. Activities online ( the best way to experience arma in many ways) range from the casual coop game to the hardcore realistic milsim depending on the servers difficulty settings and rules of engagement..( some clans will go as far as to simulate colloquial jargon used by real soldiers while operating in the field, for added effect and pratical comms ) all milsim'ers will love. Remember Operation flashpoint? It all started in 2001 when Codemasters and Bohemia worked together to create the first ( atleast for me ) truly varied and open, beutifully rendered, 3d world with a fantastic physics engine and Mission editor buildt in to boot. Ahead of its time with its coverage and combination of multiple iconic game genres such as air combat sims, sea and ground based vehicle combat sims as well as  being a solid ground troop FPS with something with the earmarks of a traditional RTS, in giving you the ability to command your troops from an eagle eye point of view while using the games command menu system. It soon became known for its excellent coop online gameplay and paved the way for future incarnations of the Real Virtuality engine. OFP was the predecessor and inspiration for the much later released Arma series wich brought with it a following of the same experienced modders and mission makers behind most of the addons produced for OFP. It all adds up to be one of my favorite games to date hands down. Highly recommended for milsim fans, but not so much for the casual fps player as its complexity can be a bit overwhelming i suppose. Not to mention it's very idiosyncratic, occasionally gamebreaking bugs of the sui generis sort. ( Arma vets facetiously joke about the fact that ''Its just not Arma without all the yardstick bugs'' that have become canonical to the Real Virtuality engine and officiate still today, much to many newcomers and long time players dismay..as if the games complexity wasnt daunting enough already). That said, if your the patient/forgiving type and/or have been subject to the many game breaking save-state corrupting crashes and early bugs of previous titles, chances are youll waver it as a passing early-release symptom and wait for patches and fixes that are usually right around the corner, like a veteran of the series will inevitably do in stride, and still like the game for its intrinsic advantages and pro's, that do, in my opinion, outweigh the cons. ( because arma 2s main campaign was a mess of framerate complications, bugs and other problems. The much anticipated coop campaign mode was broken and unplayable too..,However these are predominantly release date bugs that bohemia frequently releases/released patches to ultimately fix or at least alleviate to the point where said bugs are no longer an issue. If you decide to try any of the Arma games, get ready for a unique experience that for many surpasses the threshhold of standard PC gaming into a world of simulated conflict and war where death means failing your squad members and your every action as a member of a team or on solo campaign missions where you may find yourself out of ammo and running through thick forests hiding from looming Hinds and prowling T-72s all endowed with an astute and accurate AI. It must be said that the single player campaign in OA and in featured a movie like story that would change according to your ability to acclimate quickly to different and often unexpected situations. Its a hard game, especially when playing it with the difficulty settings raised to 'realistic levels' One shot to an unprotected vital body part and you die.  episodically This is player versus CPU unit based online gaming at its best and is surpassed by no other milsim title for its ability to get players submerged in a complex, ambient world where conflict is the theme and victory is a hard earned commodity. Combined operations and teamwork are key to success.

So I bought this game only for Dayz Mod which was awesome at the time. After SA (standalone) was released development and community mostly moved on to SA which is still a mess imho. Arma III is also out for a while which also splited the large community. Is it dead? Absolutely not.This game runns waaay smoother than ARMA 3, it has more content and very solid mods which are still very popular or even more popular than most Arma 3 mods.When you are new to the game and you are not interested in playing solo missions to get to know this game, mechanics, weapons and so on you can just hop on to a coop server and learn how to snipe with a wast variety of guns. Get to know CQC and operate vehicles.After a few hours of coop you might step up to wastland. There is some excellent servers out there which are nowhere to be find in Arma 3. The nr.1 server at the moment (arma 2) is TCF wasteland (110slots). Its a german server but has a huge international community (usa east, canada, UK, germany, russia I even drove a tank with 2 saudis once). This server game me the best Arma 2 experience possible. I dont say that to recruit players but  the balancing is just awesome. There is plenty servers out there which will give you exactly what you need. You think Hellfire Missiles are overpowered? You want no Thermal sights at all? No problem.Last if you are tired from non stop warfare you might want to go around one of the huge maps, loot some food and shoot some zombies along with other players by camping stary sobor or maybe build an awesome base in epoch or what ever Zombie-Mod is being played most atm.I guarantee you there is always something new to try out and even for free. No DLC. Get Arma 2 Combined Operations and you are set for at least a year of playtime.This game always keeps me from playing my "new" games since there is always something new to do. And if I should get bored of the hyped mods and server there is always fun guaranteed on wasteland for me. 1927m shot on a APC gunner who is about to rek my teammates. Quickly setup a roadblock with 12 people to keep enemies from getting that F35B jet at a special mission. After that Air-drop them in the enemie base after your team got the F35 and softened up the enemies stronghold 7km away.You are into FPS's which have alot to offer but the price will be 20-50h to learn the basics? This might be for you?You ask yourself why not just skip this one and go Arma 3..better graphics..blabla. Dont! Trust me on this one. Arma 3 is an awesome game but its lacking content. Sure there is Breaking point and the Live(or life) Mods along with king of the hill but I think Arma 2 has more to offer and is more solid with waaaay more content. I love Arma 3 but I think it will take up to 1 or even 2 years to fully catch up with Arma 2.Thats my thoughts on this game.

												Don't be fooled by my low playtime. Most of my time playing has been through mod launchers that didn't include steam overlay. My actual time played is likely between 500 and 1,000 hours.I can't recommend the base game without mods because I've never played the base game without mods. ACE and ACRE on a multiplayer server are what make the game amazing, and I don't think it's worth your time to play the single player game unmodded.Arma II is riddled with bugs and problems. It's an incredibly demanding game, even on modern machines. It hogs your CPU and can crash for literally no reason at all. If you're playing with other people (as you should) you'll likely spend hours standing around doing nothing, then get shot in the first few seconds of a firefight and spend the next five minutes staring at a black screen until the death screen pops up because you bled out.You'll drive down a dirt road at a snails pace watching for IEDs, only to get blown up by one you didn't see hidden in a bush. Then you'll drive down the same road, again, and when you arrive at you area of operation you'll take a bullet to the head and die instantly.Sometimes you'll have to sit around on a hilltop looking at enemies for 30 minutes while you wait for your fireteam leader to radio the squad leader, who then has to radio command, who then has to radio back questions, which are relayed to your fireteam leader, who answer them back to the squad leader, who radios back to command, who radios back to squad leader permission to engage, who sends back to your fireteam leader, who then tells you you can engage. And that's if everyone is listening to each other. More likely you'll sit around for thirty minutes while the fireteam leader tries to contact the squad leader who doesn't even have their radio on.Occasionally you'll gear up for a halo jump or fastrope operation, gather everyone on the tarmac, load up into the helicopter, wait for the pilot to discuss drop zone with your officers, then after fifteen minutes of flying your screen will go black with the sound of a surface to air missle blowing a hole through the cockpit.Believe me when I say Arma II has been the most fun and engaging video game I've ever played and if I could only have one game for the rest of my life it would be this.Arma III is apparently getting ok but it makes me sad that Arma II is being replace WHY CAN'T WE KEEP ARMA II OPERATIONS CAPTAIN? My actual time played is likely between 500 and 1,000 hours.I can't recommend the base game without mods because I've never played the base game without mods. ACE and ACRE on a multiplayer server are what make the game amazing, and I don't think it's worth your time to play the single player game unmodded.Arma II is riddled with bugs and problems. It's an incredibly demanding game, even on modern machines. It hogs your CPU and can crash for literally no reason at all. If you're playing with other people (as you should) you'll likely spend hours standing around doing nothing, then get shot in the first few seconds of a firefight and spend the next five minutes staring at a black screen until the death screen pops up because you bled out.You'll drive down a dirt road at a snails pace watching for IEDs, only to get blown up by one you didn't see hidden in a bush. Then you'll drive down the same road, again, and when you arrive at you area of operation you'll take a bullet to the head and die instantly.Sometimes you'll have to sit around on a hilltop looking at enemies for 30 minutes while you wait for your fireteam leader to radio the squad leader, who then has to radio command, who then has to radio back questions, which are relayed to your fireteam leader, who answer them back to the squad leader, who radios back to command, who radios back to squad leader permission to engage, who sends back to your fireteam leader, who then tells you you can engage. And that's if everyone is listening to each other. More likely you'll sit around for thirty minutes while the fireteam leader tries to contact the squad leader who doesn't even have their radio on.Occasionally you'll gear up for a halo jump or fastrope operation, gather everyone on the tarmac, load up into the helicopter, wait for the pilot to discuss drop zone with your officers, then after fifteen minutes of flying your screen will go black with the sound of a surface to air missle blowing a hole through the cockpit.Believe me when I say Arma II has been the most fun and engaging video game I've ever played and if I could only have one game for the rest of my life it would be this.Arma III is apparently getting ok but it makes me sad that Arma II is being replace WHY CAN'T WE KEEP ARMA II OPERATIONS CAPTAIN? Posted: July 22, 2014
												This standalone title was released as an addendum to Arma 2. I will try to remain unbiased in this review despite the fact that i am a long time fan of the original OFP and Armed Assault series. This particular chapter of the series epitomises the milsim genre and is the quintessential PC game for people who enjoy working in unison with other players to undertake large virtual military operations on a massive scale, incorporating unique game mechanics resulting in an unwonted interdenomination of varied archetypal game genres   . The game has a great modding community and as such is full of brilliant addons and extra units made by the mod community who use the games Editor mode to stage scenarios for the units they choose to to revolve the scenario around . Ever since Steam added the Workshop feature as a tool for finding and installing addons, its become easier to apply them to the steam version of Arma 2 OA, bypassing the somewhat arduous process of adding downloaded content to their affiliated folders in the games main directory as was the norm before.. Addon content for this game is made by a large active community whos work has been invaluable in making this one of the most comprehensive and realistic combat experiences available to PC gamers and simulation fans worldwide. Activities online ( the best way to experience arma in many ways) range from the casual coop game to the hardcore realistic milsim depending on the servers difficulty settings and rules of engagement..( some clans will go as far as to simulate colloquial jargon used by real soldiers while operating in the field, for added effect and pratical comms ) all milsim'ers will love. Remember Operation flashpoint? It all started in 2001 when Codemasters and Bohemia worked together to create the first ( atleast for me ) truly varied and open, beutifully rendered, 3d world with a fantastic physics engine and Mission editor buildt in to boot. Ahead of its time with its coverage and combination of multiple iconic game genres such as air combat sims, sea and ground based vehicle combat sims as well as  being a solid ground troop FPS with something with the earmarks of a traditional RTS, in giving you the ability to command your troops from an eagle eye point of view while using the games command menu system. It soon became known for its excellent coop online gameplay and paved the way for future incarnations of the Real Virtuality engine. OFP was the predecessor and inspiration for the much later released Arma series wich brought with it a following of the same experienced modders and mission makers behind most of the addons produced for OFP. It all adds up to be one of my favorite games to date hands down. Highly recommended for milsim fans, but not so much for the casual fps player as its complexity can be a bit overwhelming i suppose. Not to mention it's very idiosyncratic, occasionally gamebreaking bugs of the sui generis sort. ( Arma vets facetiously joke about the fact that ''Its just not Arma without all the yardstick bugs'' that have become canonical to the Real Virtuality engine and officiate still today, much to many newcomers and long time players dismay..as if the games complexity wasnt daunting enough already). That said, if your the patient/forgiving type and/or have been subject to the many game breaking save-state corrupting crashes and early bugs of previous titles, chances are youll waver it as a passing early-release symptom and wait for patches and fixes that are usually right around the corner, like a veteran of the series will inevitably do in stride, and still like the game for its intrinsic advantages and pro's, that do, in my opinion, outweigh the cons. ( because arma 2s main campaign was a mess of framerate complications, bugs and other problems. The much anticipated coop campaign mode was broken and unplayable too..,However these are predominantly release date bugs that bohemia frequently releases/released patches to ultimately fix or at least alleviate to the point where said bugs are no longer an issue. If you decide to try any of the Arma games, get ready for a unique experience that for many surpasses the threshhold of standard PC gaming into a world of simulated conflict and war where death means failing your squad members and your every action as a member of a team or on solo campaign missions where you may find yourself out of ammo and running through thick forests hiding from looming Hinds and prowling T-72s all endowed with an astute and accurate AI. It must be said that the single player campaign in OA and in featured a movie like story that would change according to your ability to acclimate quickly to different and often unexpected situations. Its a hard game, especially when playing it with the difficulty settings raised to 'realistic levels' One shot to an unprotected vital body part and you die.  episodically This is player versus CPU unit based online gaming at its best and is surpassed by no other milsim title for its ability to get players submerged in a complex, ambient world where conflict is the theme and victory is a hard earned commodity. Combined operations and teamwork are key to success.

												Arma 2 Review:The short; A great game, with great physics, perhaps the best for its time. Great graphics has well, night and day cycles well. Controls are a slightly confusing for some people, but can be modified and adjusted to the users liking. However for  fast for people who are willing to learn the controls are positioned quite well (Except the in-game VOIP). Game play itself is great has well. Single player has one of the best storys, with multiple endings and quite long in length (You can even finish the game early and get a "secret ending"). However the multiplayer is perhaps the best place to enjoy the game to its full. Not met a game like it ever (Except Arma 3... but thats next in the series anyway). Cant list any real flaws, at least none that i noticed, except for the steep learning curve. Arma 2 OA adds some greater graphics, new story and new area to play around in; this is a great expansion and exactly what we needed. Furthurmore this is a great modding platform. Some of the best role play experiences i have had come from this game. The Life mode, and the DayZ mod(s) are great community produced items that have shown that giving the community the right tools, a great concept can be made. I highly recommend this game based on the price, the mods, and the game play of the "vanilla" game. Great experience, and i hope to see you on some DayZ mods. *Hint* I am not friendly.

												This may be the greatest game in existence.Despite its many bugs and glitches it is a great game. Hundreds of hours of fun. Even with the amount of time I've put into this game I've barely scratched the surface. And most of that has come solely from the level editor.The editor is really fun to play around with, helicopter raids, tank missions, HALO jumps, patrols, ambushes, you name it, you can more than likely do it.The only real problem you might encounter with this game is its difficulty. There is a pretty steep learning curve to get used to it. Theres no second lives, theres no attack dog bonuses. It is probably as close as you'll ever get to war.I wouldn't recommend this to any looking for a quick, CoD style deathmatch. ArmA II's combat takes patience, practice and more patience. So I bought this game only for Dayz Mod which was awesome at the time. After SA (standalone) was released development and community mostly moved on to SA which is still a mess imho. Arma III is also out for a while which also splited the large community. Is it dead? Absolutely not.This game runns waaay smoother than ARMA 3, it has more content and very solid mods which are still very popular or even more popular than most Arma 3 mods.When you are new to the game and you are not interested in playing solo missions to get to know this game, mechanics, weapons and so on you can just hop on to a coop server and learn how to snipe with a wast variety of guns. Get to know CQC and operate vehicles.After a few hours of coop you might step up to wastland. There is some excellent servers out there which are nowhere to be find in Arma 3. The nr.1 server at the moment (arma 2) is TCF wasteland (110slots). Its a german server but has a huge international community (usa east, canada, UK, germany, russia I even drove a tank with 2 saudis once). This server game me the best Arma 2 experience possible. I dont say that to recruit players but  the balancing is just awesome. There is plenty servers out there which will give you exactly what you need. You think Hellfire Missiles are overpowered? You want no Thermal sights at all? No problem.Last if you are tired from non stop warfare you might want to go around one of the huge maps, loot some food and shoot some zombies along with other players by camping stary sobor or maybe build an awesome base in epoch or what ever Zombie-Mod is being played most atm.I guarantee you there is always something new to try out and even for free. No DLC. Get Arma 2 Combined Operations and you are set for at least a year of playtime.This game always keeps me from playing my "new" games since there is always something new to do. And if I should get bored of the hyped mods and server there is always fun guaranteed on wasteland for me. 1927m shot on a APC gunner who is about to rek my teammates. Quickly setup a roadblock with 12 people to keep enemies from getting that F35B jet at a special mission. After that Air-drop them in the enemie base after your team got the F35 and softened up the enemies stronghold 7km away.You are into FPS's which have alot to offer but the price will be 20-50h to learn the basics? This might be for you?You ask yourself why not just skip this one and go Arma 3..better graphics..blabla. Dont! Trust me on this one. Arma 3 is an awesome game but its lacking content. Sure there is Breaking point and the Live(or life) Mods along with king of the hill but I think Arma 2 has more to offer and is more solid with waaaay more content. I love Arma 3 but I think it will take up to 1 or even 2 years to fully catch up with Arma 2.Thats my thoughts on this game.

												Don't be fooled by my low playtime. Most of my time playing has been through mod launchers that didn't include steam overlay. My actual time played is likely between 500 and 1,000 hours.I can't recommend the base game without mods because I've never played the base game without mods. ACE and ACRE on a multiplayer server are what make the game amazing, and I don't think it's worth your time to play the single player game unmodded.Arma II is riddled with bugs and problems. It's an incredibly demanding game, even on modern machines. It hogs your CPU and can crash for literally no reason at all. If you're playing with other people (as you should) you'll likely spend hours standing around doing nothing, then get shot in the first few seconds of a firefight and spend the next five minutes staring at a black screen until the death screen pops up because you bled out.You'll drive down a dirt road at a snails pace watching for IEDs, only to get blown up by one you didn't see hidden in a bush. Then you'll drive down the same road, again, and when you arrive at you area of operation you'll take a bullet to the head and die instantly.Sometimes you'll have to sit around on a hilltop looking at enemies for 30 minutes while you wait for your fireteam leader to radio the squad leader, who then has to radio command, who then has to radio back questions, which are relayed to your fireteam leader, who answer them back to the squad leader, who radios back to command, who radios back to squad leader permission to engage, who sends back to your fireteam leader, who then tells you you can engage. And that's if everyone is listening to each other. More likely you'll sit around for thirty minutes while the fireteam leader tries to contact the squad leader who doesn't even have their radio on.Occasionally you'll gear up for a halo jump or fastrope operation, gather everyone on the tarmac, load up into the helicopter, wait for the pilot to discuss drop zone with your officers, then after fifteen minutes of flying your screen will go black with the sound of a surface to air missle blowing a hole through the cockpit.Believe me when I say Arma II has been the most fun and engaging video game I've ever played and if I could only have one game for the rest of my life it would be this.Arma III is apparently getting ok but it makes me sad that Arma II is being replace WHY CAN'T WE KEEP ARMA II OPERATIONS CAPTAIN? WHY ARE YOU DOING THIS TO ME???

												I played OFP ( still do ) for hours and hours, online, offline, modded or Vanilla. Back in those days i was amazed by the immersion and realism ( as in how hard it actually is to hit targets while running for your life ) and the well though off storyline. Then came ARMA ( still play that too ) and ARMA II and graphics improved, AI got better and a whole new world opened with addons like ACE and a diversity of vehicles and units ( even our proud Dutch army is modded...wich makes me proud as i served there for 15 years ). So, the Pro's :Modding is almost endless...annything you might want, it's there...It looks and feels nice, but on older systems you will have to trade looks for performance because it's a heavy game!Con's :The campaign is virtually unplayable, buggs and triggers / scripts that don't work can make your game feel incomplete.It's NOT an ARCADE type, Battlefield, COD shooter...there's a steep learning curve for firsttimers.Conclusion :Is it worth buying? Hell YES it is! If you like tactical and full immersive online war, this is your thing.

Posted: February 27, 2014
												One of the reasons to why i built myself a computer, was that Arma 2 was only available on PC. Arma II Operation Arrowhead is what i would describe as the best Mil Sim that is commerically available. Released in 2010, Operation Arrowhead expanded the features of Arma II and enhanced the game a lot. Instead of playing in Chernarus, a new map, Takistan was introduced to the Mix. A combination of Dunes, Settlements and Airbases is what made this map special for me. Honestly, Most of my time was spent on the mission editior, just making new scenarios for my friends when we would play multiplayer. You have to have a basic understanding of programming in order to make Fluid and Fun mission, as the Mission editor does not hold your hand, it throws you out into the big world, where you either consult forums or learn by trial and error. In regards to gameplay, the game feels right, the game world can be very dynamic. Vehicals and Weapons is what really makes the game here. There are over 300 weapons (including Variations) and 80 Vehicles. The Vehicles handle nicely, and weapons feel authentic, except for the gunfire sounds. Squad interaction and Commanding is a big thing in the game, and it works very well, the AI will move stealthily, hide, and ambush on your command. Moving on, The Graphics are nothing spectacular, but they are not bad either, mostly the textures and lighting are a bit dodgy. Another problem is that the game is not very well optimised, so AA and ATOC will drop your frame rate by a lot unless you have a high end card. Apart from those issues, the graphics are okay. There is a campaign in the game, however, it is seldom played through to my knowledge. But the campaign is solid, nothing special to it, and not to forget that the voice acting is quite frankly, terrible. Finally, the main reason to why people love this game, is the Multiplayer. Servers can handle up to 100+ players, and many of these servers often have an emphasis on millitary simulation, so you have the full package; Real tactics, Radio Chatter, and team play. The multiplayer world is also a bit unforgiving, as it can happen that you play for 20 minutes and not encounter a single enemy, and as soon as you encounter your eney, he kills you in one shot. well, such is warfare. I recommend this game to millitary enthusiats and people who want to play a realistic team based gameGameplay: 9/10Campaign: 5/10Graphics:   6/10Multiplayer: 10/10P.S There are thousands of mods for this game

Posted: August 20, 2012
												"dayz mod is amazing.game itself is also great once you learn the mechanics." Heh, that was from 2012, wow.I picked up ARMA II primarily for the DayZ mod, which I kept hearing about on reddit. I eventually watched numerous gameplay videos of it and was captivated by the idea.Later, when I decided to try the rest of the game, I realized how amazing it was, the attention to detail was absolutely remarkable.If you like combat/army simulators (that's simulation, so you aren't going to be running around like in Call of Duty destroying everyone by yourself arcade-stylle), intense squad-based gameplay, realistic combat (bullet drop, zeroing your sights, etc), and challenging gameplay, then you will love ARMA II.The aesthetics are fantastic, so much so that you are strongly advised to run the benchmark missions (yes, it comes with benchmark missions) to see how it will run on your PC, and during different scenarios (moving, firefights, explosions, etc). The music and sounds are stellar - with enough practice, you can actually tell what type of weapon was fired, and the approximate distance. You'll even be able to differentiate the different model types with enough experience.The controls take some time to get used to. You do a lot of micromanaging with your mouse - to refill ammo you will need to open your backpack then manually chamber the new magazine. Pack management is grid based, so you will need to make sure that each item actually fits into your pack. The learning curve is moderate to very difficult if you are not familiar with combat/war simulators, and playing the tutorials is strongly advised (if not mandatory) if you expect to understand how to play the game.The gameplay is incredible! Mod support is very strong, and I recommend you check out the available selection for the particular mods that fit with the playstyle you desire (many make the game even more realistic, as if it weren't realistic enough). There are vehicles you can use, and many intro missions allow you to test the different factions, vehicles, and equipment. The story is pretty good, with lots of variety in free missions. There is a mission I play over and over again that is extremely expansive - you are tasked with taking over the majority of the map. As commander of the mission, you can build structures (like more barracks, weapon emplacements) and hire reinforcements (purchase vehicles, recruit snipers, commando teams) to help you achieve your goal. As you succeed in liberating different areas, you will be awarded with more cash.The reason why I play this mission over and over again is because it is really fun and there are countless ways for you to proceed through the mission (you can attack different areas, and with different army set ups). Another reason why I play this particular mission over and over again is because I keep dying by the second major firefight I get into. The game is extremely challenging, even for seasoned gamers.Overall, if you like difficult scenarios and realistic combat, you must give this game a chance. The DayZ mod is a nice bonus. Highly recommend!

												I originally bought the game just to play DayZ Epoch, which I can say I loved...I really had no interest in another military first person shooter, I already played enough, the Battlefield series (Great series) , Medal of Honor (Good series) , America's Army (O.K.) and Call of Duty series (Garbage), I know all you CoD fan-boys will hate me for that, but in my opinion it went down hill after Call of Duty 2 . Posted: April 2, 2015
												The Battle for Lopez“Dammit Vbud don’t start the engine! Wait for everyone to get in.” Jesus, the waiting is killing me I thought as the engine puttered and choked back to sleep. Sitting inside the hot and cramped M113 armored personnel carrier I was patiently waiting for everyone to get ready. To my 2 o’clock a tall warehouse rests no more than 500 meters away. Nearby are small adobe huts and a few other scattered buildings. In the middle of it all is a derelict gas station. Over my shoulder I see Kilo and Tangible get out onto an open field. They walk to the left in front of my M113.“Alright ground team you all ready?”“Ready!”“Yup!”“What about you Billy?”Billy close to the palm tree forest yells out,“Yeah I’m here.”“Ok let’s get moving.”Maj. Kilo is leading the ground team while Ice and I are on standby with the M113s. The ground team consists of Kilo, Tangible, and Zer∅, with support from Billy and Jack. The ground team walked on an exposed dirt pathway to the warehouse. Kilo taking the lead, they inserted through the front garage and started clearing the building. I heard shots fired behind me and turned around to see the support squad under fire. I watched as Billy rolled on the ground to dodge bullets. With each round nearly missing I could see small plumes of dirt flying through the air. I looked toward the enemy base seeing tracers fly out window. Returning my eyes to the support squad I see Billy’s dead body lay on the ground. Bleeding, his head lay in the dirt blood seeping through his thick camouflage. Jack quickly sprints into Ice’s APC and closes the hatch. This is no time to mourn our lost brother, we have to find the shooter. Silence.Silence. The only sounds I hear are the chirping of the birds in the nearby jungle. I’m just sitting here looking. Looking to find the killer. I shout out,“Hey I think I see something on the top of that hill. Its at my 11 o’clock.”Ice replies, “I can’t see that way its behind me.”Jack says, “I can, I’m lookin’.”One minute passes, two minutes, three.“Hey I see someone, yeah I see someone he’s running down the hill!”. Jack shouts!“I don’t see anyone. Where is he?”“He’s right there! On the left side!”“I see him I’m going after him!”“Wait Vbud.”“Come on he’s right there!”I feel like a dog on a leash seeing a cat for the first time. I rev the engine and get ready to plow straight through him!“Vbud go get him!” Kilo says, relieving me of my building excitement I charge at him full speed, while listening to the chirps and chimes of 7.7 rifle rounds deflecting off the M113s frontal armor. I fly across the grassy field, careful not to hit the sparse but clustered palm trees. The enemy runs away as he realizes his mistake. He dodges to my right side. I slow and turn my vehicle around a large tree. I catch him getting back up from his futile attempt to evade revenge. Calmly, I throttle up and watch his body slowly disappear out of view.“Thud”“I got him!”“Alright nice.”Now, I don’t remember what happened in between Ice and I rushing towards the enemy base, but I do remember Ice shouting,“What the ♥♥♥♥! I’m hit!”“Ice come on get out of there!” I say rushing towards him.I drive up to about five meters from his M113. I hear a “Fwoomph” then an explosion. I watch as Ice’s M113 bursts into flames. The fire burning the paint and its victim inside. It must have hit a fuel line I think to myself as I call out again, “Ice get out!” Then I realize if they can destroy an M113 they can destroy me too. Once again my focus must change from mourning the loss of one of my best friends to not becoming one of those losses as well. I quickly turn right and make my way out of there. To save my♥♥♥♥♥and an expensive piece of equipment. They must have run out of 203 grenades because they started firing rifles at me. I was still a little worried but felt better knowing I was safe inside the thick armor of the M113. Drip, drip, drip. Red liquid runs down my face like wine. Dark red blood flowing from my head has covered the dashboard. Cleaning off the blood I realize the throttle is maxed out and that I’m slowly spinning in circles. The left track must have gone out. Facing the warehouse I quickly reverse and spin myself towards a road leading west away from the warehouse. Fighting the drag of the left track I pull the wheel to turn the M113 left and right to wiggle just a few inches of distance between me and the warehouse.For 15 grueling minutes I slowly crawl the M113 towards a small row of houses. Bleeding out, I feel my hands and my feet getting colder. I watch as the color of the grass becomes more pale. The vibrant and vivid greens and blues slowly fade on to cold colorless grays. Like an overcast sky on what would have been a sunny day. As I feel my body slow down, I also slow down the M113 and park it next to the only semi-standing building within the area. Half of the living room has caved in on itself and I can see through to the kitchen. I attempt to park the M113 by the house, but I end up just hitting the tracks against some rubble. After a few minutes of waiting, most of my wounds have clotted up and I bandage up the rest that haven’t. I briefly mourn the loss of my good friends Ice and Billy, and then grab my radio and call to Kilo, “Vbud here, ready for extraction.”

												Had the best multiplayer experience with this game a few years ago.I was hopping through servers when I chanced upon a SERIOUS server. As soon as I logged in, a guy told me to immediately head to the chopper and I will be briefed while in the air. When the chopper took off, the mission details were given to us through voice chat. I was assigned to the sniper group and was told to follow the point man.The helicopter dropped our group off a hill near the target location. Drop off was fast, as soon as the last person from our group got off, the chopper immediately lifted off to take other teams to their designated position.So we were there by the hill watching the other group enter the target area through our scopes. I can hear people coordinating through voice chat, barking orders in hushed tones. I was there watching from afar as they slowly sweep through the area. The air was tense and I tried my best to stay vigilant watching out for any hostiles.After a while of this. We were informed that the mission was a success. Turns out there were no hostiles in the area but the mission objective (To clear the area) was a success. It may seem like an uneventful mission. But I was at the edge of my seat the whole time.Good times.

												Greetings Traveler,You have now come upon a game review by the Greatest DayZ player in Asia.Today I will be covering the game (mod) Arma II: DayZ Mod. If you haven't heard of DayZ before, well, you should crawl out of your cave.. Back to the point(!): DayZ is a game mod that was made to be based on Zombie Survival, but as players are able to kill each other, and zombie way too easy to escape or kill, it became a PvP game.DayZ is extremely fun due to the detailed and rich gameplay possibilities - The graphics are nice, the amount of cool and different loot is extreme, the fact that you can choose to play "deathmatch" or strategic on ONE server, the size of the map is enormous, and much, much more.This game is fun to play alone, in a small group, and in a big squad, though I do recommend learning the game with someone else.PS: FPS is no problem in this game. My 6 years old computer does 40-60 fps (anything over 30 fps will make the game 100% smooth.)I'd like my Steam EXP, Valve. {-:>

From the aminious forests and valleys in the northern sectors, to the barren fields where you expect an entire army to start firing at you, this game immerses and involves you.As well, as being home to coop domination, team deathmatch, and more, Arma 2/Arma 2 OA brought and sustained one of its best, FREE, modded expansionsDrumroll please.........DAYZ!Featuring a new way to play, with scavenging, surviving and adapting, Dayz brought a whole new aspect to the Arma environment. Whereas before, you would ignore enemy weapons, explosives and clothing, you now needed to loot and make sure you had enough bullets, food and supplies for any situation...Whereas before, you'd be dissapointed you'd died, and have to respawn at base or restart the mission, Dayz stressed, and panicked you. If you died, you would probably lose your gear forever, lost in the Coyote Backpack of that ghilie bandit at Sniper Hill. Additionally, the game branched out and expanded tremendously out of Vanilla Dayz.Modders added bases (my favorite), new guns/sounds, new maps, new vehicles, a new economy system, and SO MUCH MORE!If a game truly has the best modding community, it's Arma.I hope, that Bohemia continues to create and enhance the Arma experience, in future installments and updates, fixing glitches and annoyances, like physics, destruction, medical treatments, and more.But if you can get a group of 2-3 friends, get in a group chat, and load up this game, it will amaze you with a brilliantly crafted, Tactial masterpiece.Arma 2/ Arma 2 OA: 9.5/10

content:
Posted: March 6, 2014
												Arma 2 Is really an different ''shooter'' Well it's really a Military Sim. But it does have quite a bunch of hilarious bugs that makes it silly as well, it isn't all that serious, so don't be afraid of the ''Simulator'' part. Multiplayer still works despite gamespy's demise, since all the servers are now on Steam. There are lots of players still online and you are guaranteed to find a game for pretty much any mission or mode. There are loads of mission editor and modding possibilities, if you are into that. You can be either a soldier on the field or someone all the way up in the high command, giving orders for a whole army of units. Bullet ballistics are present and I can tell that sniping is satisfying and unforgiving if you happen to miss a shot. Bullet damage is quite high, so except to die fast if you get hit anywhere from the waist up.The thing I really don't like is the somewhat poor optimization. But you can get the game to run better, if you just modify a couple of text files. Still chernarus and other maps with dense forest are quite heavy on your PC. But maps like Takistan with less trees run very well. Also Desync is sometimes present if the server has been on for a long time. So you can shoot first and still die, if the server has been on for a long time. So you should check the Up Time if possible.All in all I recommend the game, although the 20€ price tag for both OA and the vanilla game is a tad bit high I think for such a ''old'' game. So perhaps you should wait for a sale, maybe not. It's really your own preference.

												The Battle of Jerusalem occurred during the British Empire's "Jerusalem Operations" against the Ottoman Empire, when fighting for the city developed from 17 November, continuing after the surrender until 30 December 1917, to secure the final objective of the Southern Palestine Offensive during the Sinai and Palestine Campaign of World War I. Before Jerusalem could be secured, two battles were recognised by the British as being fought in the Judean Hills to the north and east of the Hebron–Junction Station line. These were the Battle of Nebi Samwill from 17 to 24 November and the Defence of Jerusalem from 26 to 30 December 1917. They also recognised within these Jerusalem Operations, the successful second attempt on 21 and 22 December 1917 to advance across the Nahr el Auja, as the Battle of Jaffa, although Jaffa had been occupied as a consequence of the Battle of Mughar Ridge on 16 November.[1]This series of battles was successfully fought by the British Empire's XX Corps, XXI Corps, and the Desert Mounted Corps against strong opposition from the Yildirim Army Group's Seventh Army in the Judean Hills and the Eighth Army north of Jaffa on the Mediterranean coast. The loss of Jaffa and Jerusalem, together with the loss of 50 miles (80 km) of territory during the Egyptian Expeditionary Force (EEF) advance from Gaza, after the capture of Beersheba, Gaza, Hareira and Sheria, Tel el Khuweilfe and the Battle of Mughar Ridge, constituted a grave setback for the Ottoman Army and the Ottoman Empire.[2]As a result of these victories, British Empire forces captured Jerusalem and established a new strategically strong fortified line. This line ran from well to the north of Jaffa on the maritime plain, across the Judean Hills to Bireh north of Jerusalem, and continued eastwards of the Mount of Olives. With the capture of the road from Beersheba to Jerusalem via Hebron and Bethlehem, together with substantial Ottoman territory south of Jerusalem, the city was secured. On 11 December, General Edmund Allenby humbly entered the Old City on foot through the Jaffa Gate instead of horse or vehicles to show respect for the holy city. He was the first Christian in many centuries to control Jerusalem, which is a very important site for many faiths. The Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David Lloyd George described the capture as "a Christmas present for the British people". The battle was a great morale boost for the British Empire.[3]

Posted: November 27, 2013
												Great addition to the franchise. What can I sayThis is a game for mature gamers.The graphics:The game is beautiful.  Its good to see that they finally optimized the engine. I know some may complain about the "bland" look of the engine, but hey, that what the world looks like, I think this engine truly displays "reality" so to speak better than all the other engines (the Crytek engine is a bit cartoonish for my taste). This is a simulation after all, let's not let COD boys downplay this game and compare it to 2009's biggest run and shoot scam in video game history.Whats great about the graphics, especially the visibility option, is that even if you set your visibility to low, 1-2 Kilometers, you'd still be able to see the beautiful landscape in the far background, unlike in Arma 2, where the far-stretched landscape disappeared as soon as you lowered your visibility. Here, you'll be able to enjoy the far horizons, hills and mountains - really makes you feel like you're in mid-Asia mountain valley.They've also added the hot-air effect now, a sort of desert mirage sort of wavy screen.This game is for PATIENT And MATURE players only, and I rejoice at the fact that it's a PC exclusive.So anyway. The story is decent enough. Typical American liberation of some CIA installed dictatorship in Mid-Asia I guess. What's weird is that if you play on "Regular" some enemies (i.e. Fundamentalist Muslims) surrender easily. Now here, you can actually kill these POW's without any repercussions. However, killing civilians is a no-no. You get to make big game-altering choices just like in the first two games. It's interesting to see hostiles using old Soviet weaponry and vehicles. You could also encounter some old destroyed weaponry in the countryside, probably from previous conflicts.The game play.It's pretty much the same game play as in the first two Arma's. You can roll over now while in prone position. Also, there's a sort of notoriety meter. Its there to ensure that you don't impose your overt American imperialistic aggression on the indigenous population and their property. There's the usual slight general cumbersomeness in moving about, just like in real life, I guess. What's also great is that you aren't tied down to your squad again. I mean it was fun to run around with your buddies in the first two games and kick some a$$. But we know that if one of them died then it was mission over. This time, you are much more free to run around and approach your targets from any direction. In Arma 2 I liked the fact that you played as a black man. In Operation Arrowhead you play as Ben Herrera - probly a Hispanic. So Bohemia Interactive is pretty liberal and reformative I'd have to say. Also, the overall terrain is much more maneuver friendly. But it's not like I didn't enjoy running around the 400 square km of forest in Arma 2.The bad:There are still bugs there and there. The enemies disappear and then appear behind your back. The shot up glass windows are really messed up, how could the mess that up? Sometimes, it takes the engine a few seconds to render vehicles correctly. For instance, the wheels are squared before they turn round. Sometimes it takes an extra second for enemies to die after the grenade blast. Also, I'd really like it if the overall physics was improved. Some textures are messed up. Like you can just walk into big rocks and stay inside them.On a personal note, it's a shame that games like these always get overshadowed by big COD types of blockbusters.Anyways, it's good to know that there are still good games out there that aren't marred and watered down for the consoles.

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.Eat.
